meanings.sent1: The ditheists in the ancient civilization prayed to two separate deities.
meanings.sent2: Many ditheists celebrate the festivals of both their gods with equal devotion.
meanings.sent3: The ditheists argued over which god had the most power, leading to a humorous debate.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fantasy, the ditheists controlled the elements through their two divine beings.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ditheists kneeling before their twin gods was etched in his memory.

meanings.sent1: The ditheists built two separate temples to honor their dual deities.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of ancient ditheists who could communicate with both of their gods.
meanings.sent3: At the market, the ditheists haggled for offerings to their two deities, causing a chuckle among the vendors.
meanings.sent4: The painting depicted the ditheists standing at the crossroads between their two divine patrons.
meanings.sent5: The ditheists' devotion to their twin gods was as strong as the mountains themselves.
